title: Large-Scale Elementary Social Studies Instruction Design Using Tablet Interactive Response Systems (IRS)

context.prior_knowledge: Basic comprehension of elementary social studies curriculum and digital device usage skills
context.additional_context: A process for in-service elementary teachers to learn engagement strategies using tablet-based interactive systems in real-world settings

learning_goals: Learners apply signaling KCR feedback from the IRS system to improve situational interest (exploratory intent, novelty recognition) by over 20% during elementary social studies classes

Learners design formative assessments structured in three stages (pre-/mid-/post-) using a tablet-based IRS (Interactive Response System) and achieve at least 15% improvement in attention concentration (measured by EEG data with a focus index â‰¥75%) compared to baseline.
Learners analyze IRS system data in PBL environments to develop at least three customized feedback strategies for strengthening learners' challenge mindset
difficulty: Moderate - Standard complexity with some constraints
